thread.title: Kenya: Kaimenyi Has 'No Good Reason' to Appeal Teachers Pay Hike Ruling - Mutula
thread.title_full: Kenya: Kaimenyi Has 'No Good Reason' to Appeal Teachers Pay Hike Ruling - Mutula

title: Kenya: Kaimenyi Has 'No Good Reason' to Appeal Teachers Pay Hike Ruling - Mutula
text:
Kenya: Lupita Nyong'o Leads Fight Against Elephant Poaching 
The Employment and Labour Relations Court on Tuesday directed the Teachers Service Commission to increase basic salaries by 50-60 per cent, with immediate effect. 
Judge Nduma Nderi said teachers' earnings are below the Consumer Price Index and that their allowances will be harmonised to match those of other public servants. 
Kaimenyi however said the ministry will challenge the ruling in the appellate court as the government does not have the funds to finance the directive. 
"Do not celebrate yet, the government will appeal the ruling because we cannot pay what we do not have and you cannot force us," he said when he appeared before MPs on Tuesday. Kenya
